definition: to support/to sustain/to erect/to raise/branch/division/to draw money/classifier for rods such as pens and guns, for army divisions and for songs or compositions
(once) again/also/both... and.../and yet/(used for emphasis) anyway
to be in favor of/to support/to back/support/backing/to stand by/CL:個|个[ge4]
expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
branch (of company, river etc)/to branch/to diverge/to ramify/to subdivide

sentences.english: I think I need an ice-cream to chill out.
sentences.chinese: 我想吃支冰淇淋放松一下。

sentences.english: The ramus colla teralis is absent in the anterior me, enteric artery.
sentences.chinese: 肠系膜前动脉不分出侧副支。

sentences.english: Diagnoses a clade or monophyletic group.
sentences.chinese: 判断一个演化支或单源群。

sentences.english: According to the regulations of Ministry of Education, hourly payment is based on the actual teaching hours.
sentences.chinese: 授课钟点费依教育部规定按实际授课时数核实支给。

sentences.english: A city of eastern Netherlands on the lower Rhine River east-southeast of Utrecht.
sentences.chinese: 荷兰东部城市，位于莱茵河下游乌得勒支东南偏东部。

sentences.english: Large-span suspended-dome was adopted in Ji nan Olympic Center Gymnasium.
sentences.chinese: 济南奥体中心体育馆采用大跨度弦支穹顶结构。

sentences.english: When he picked up a harmonica, he learned to play it in hours.
sentences.chinese: 当他获得一只支口琴，在几小时之内就可以学会演奏。

sentences.english: I'm like a junkie wanting a proper fix these days.
sentences.chinese: 我这些天就像个瘾君子一样等着给我来支强心剂。
接下来是一盘10支曲目的专辑《祖罗帕》。

sentences.english: It would be better if he simply lent a sympathetic ear.
sentences.chinese: 其实他们只要支着耳朵同情地倾听就行了。

sentences.english: For a moment a flaming ring was raised high up on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 刹那间，一个熊熊燃烧的火圈被高高地支了起来。

sentences.english: When the four foundations of mindfulness are developed and cultivated, they fulfill the seven enlightenment factors.
sentences.chinese: 而当四念住被发展建立起来的时候，就能成就七觉支。

sentences.english: Many flattering relatives fawned on the rich old man.
sentences.chinese: 许多好谄媚的亲戚支巴结那个富有的老人。

sentences.english: They had to prop up the tree with long poles under the branches.
sentences.chinese: 他们得用长杆支着大树枝把树撑住。

sentences.english: The bovine hearts blocked at the left anterior descending artery for 45 minutes are made as an ischemic model.
sentences.chinese: 阻断牛心脏前降支动脉45分钟作为缺血心肌模型。

sentences.english: Her money is tied up in securities and is not available to her at present.
sentences.chinese: 她的钱用来买了证券，目前她还不能支用。

definition: New Armies (modernized Qing armies, trained and equipped according to Western standards, founded after Japan's victory in the First Sino-Japanese War in 1895)
a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc
classifier for coins, rings, badges, pearls, sporting medals, rockets, satellites etc/tree trunk/whip/wooden peg, used as a gag for marching soldiers (old)
to ascertain/to act on/to criticize/to pass on/classifier for batches, lots, military flights/tier (for the ranking of universities and colleges)
to compete/to take part in a competition
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]
wing (of an air force)/sports team representing a combination of entities (e.g. United Korea)
echelon (military)/(of an organisation) group of persons of one level or grade
